thread.title: Manchester United financial results revealed: Club debt rises 27 per cent to £409.3million - Irish Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Manchester United financial results revealed: Club debt rises 27 per cent to £409.3million - Irish Mirror Online

author: Alex Richards
title: Manchester United financial results revealed: Club debt rises 27 per cent to £409.3million - Irish Mirror Online
text:
However Woodward is pleased with how things are going under Mourinho (Photo: John Peters/Man Utd via Getty Images) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United's latest financial results have revealed a 27 per cent rise in the club's debt - put down to the post- Brexit vote collapse of the pound. 
The debt has surged to £409.3million, despite the club being on course to post record revenues. 
Club revenue is up 18 per cent year-on-year, rising to £157.9million during the second quarter, with profit also rising six per cent, a figure of £17.5million. United continue to grow commercially (Photo: John Peters) 
"We are please to be competing for the first available trophy of the season when we travel to face Southampton in the EFL Cup final this month," declared Executive vice chairman Ed Woodward. 
"The robustness of our business model continues to be reflected in our strong quarterly financial results and we remain on track to deliver record revenues for the year. 
"Finally I'd like to congratulate Wayne Rooney on becoming Manchester United's all-time record goal scorer - achieving the remarkable feat of scoring 250 goals over the last 13 seasons, surpassing Sir Bobby Charlton's record which has stood for 44 years." 
More to follow... 
We'll be bringing you the very latest updates, pictures and video on this breaking news story.
